HttpUnit is essentially a set of helper classes that let your JUnit tests
request web pages and parse the resultant response from a web server. Have
you read the HttpUnit documentation at
http://httpunit.sourceforge.net/doc/Cookbook.html ? I found it a very quick
read and very easy to follow.

HttpUnit lets you formulate an HTTP request (including parameters that would
be generated by a form submission), and provides a number of helper methods
to parse out the returned HTML. One thing you might want to consider is a
way of identifying which page was returned by the server. For our
application, we embedded HTML META tags in each page. When requesting a page
with HttpUnit, we then check the META tag in the response to ensure that we
got the expected page back.

I have some sample code, but I don't think it would make much sense to you
until you read the aforementioned documentation. If, after you read the
docs, you still want it, let me know.

Regards,
Matt Humphrey

From: guanying [mailto:ying_guan@...]

Subject: [junit] JUnit &&HttpUnit


This a very simple question.

Does anyone know how to apply JUnit and HttpUnit to test the web server
response .Now I can use JUnit to test,but I don't know how to  combine JUnit
with HttpUnit.

Could you show me some light on using it from the very beginning.

Could you give me some example of it if possible.

Thank you in advance.



                                                          Gilyy
